Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: https://youtu.be/G1c4MQgjtCM

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes thats right I uploaded a blockchain into a blockchain ðŸ˜„

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Delayed Delayed Proof of Work?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Didnt notarise it no... Just needed to get something done to prove it works before I take a day off.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: And so others can try and test it ... I used the repo of scripts I posted very late last night... it all works.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: at least 99% works .. not sure why the tgz got cut off at the end, but all the files were there after extracting it ... the file gets split up and converted from hex to string about 5 times during the whole process, I'm surprised it works at all tbh....

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But its pretty freeking fast right ðŸ˜„

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Isn't what you just did there, a centralised version of dPoW?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: In relation to uploading a blockchain onto another blockchain that is controlled by 1 person

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: so you now have a time stamp (notarisation if you like) of that initial blockchain

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: hmmmm I guess so ... Alright said he wanted to use a stream chain to save a copy of any chain ever in STAKED ... so a permanant copy is always avalibe after they are removed from the cluster

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: CdPoW :trollface:

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You mean *more* centralised :trollface:

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: True ðŸ˜›

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This tech along with staked, takes notarisation adn makes it distributed

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So there can be infinity notary node networks

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: People can no longer yell centralisation

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: how does staked add to that

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: staked is how the chains will be notarised ... basically once its finished a notary node will be a docker image

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you can use that to spin up a whole notary network

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: on demand... along with the streamre chain  (or any other ondemand chain you can think of) and notarise it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: once finished it can all disappear

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: so the whole 'notary network' will be the staked miners?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not sure yet

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Still many things to work out .

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: at first it will be a set netowrk of staked notaries

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Wait, so you mean you could have a notary node chain that would use it's miners to conduct the notarisation instead of the 64 notaries?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but setting it up is so simple anyone cna just make their own, they dont HAVE to use ours, but ours will be cheaper.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not exactly... the notary nodes are still notary nodes the same as KMD ones, but they run a diffrent network and st of pukeys

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Really need a way to store the pubkeys i a blockchain, once that is solved then its trivial to start a chain (or chains) and a notary network to notarise those chains.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: KMD notary nodes are always there, to notarise KMD->BTC but they simply cannot handle thousands or millions of chains...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: need to distribute the load

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: So you're solving the notary issue created by the Streamed chain having as many chains as people want, by using staked to distribute notarisations

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: in a nutshell yes ... in making staked, we inadvertantly created a way for AC's to have diffrent notary nodes to KMD while using the same code base and binaries...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Which means, that once I can figure out how to remove the pubkeys from the source code and have it loaded from a blockchain, you can have aas many notary nodes netowrks as you want each for diffrent chains, all notarising to KMD.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: They can be permenant like staked will be, or simplyt an ondeamnd network, for streamer chains, or things similar to that.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Obviously... most of the uses case for this will be centralised, but as its mostly a thing for data, not currency I dont see much of an isssue with that. ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The network is still p2p and distributed/decentralised

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So its a good way to make sure your data cannot be censored or removed from the internet

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: That is wild

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: And having multiple netowrks of notary nodes, introduces more competition

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: which can only be good

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I like the idea of creating a chain that's service is notarisation. Coin holders get paid a dividend of the notarisation fees

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes something like that ... staked will be that ... but we still need to work out exactly how it will work.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: staked will be 50% PoS

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so holders get coins anyway

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and the ddemand for the coin comes from the notarisation fees

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: which will be much higher than KMD charges btw ...

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Yeah exactly

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We hope to get a KMD notary node for staked, which will supply the KMD needed to pay for notaisations

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then the whole thing can run with STAKED as its currency

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: So Staked will be notarised onto KMD?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes it already is

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: all testnet chains are notarised to KMD

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Notary nodes will be paid per notariation OR a percentage of the minign rewards, like a founderss fee... still not 100% sure on details, still working these things out, we hope to make an annoumcment and launch STAKED as a chain soon.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: oh and anyone can be a notary node really... as long as it does not exceed 64, as thats the highest it can go. after that a seperate netowrk would need to be used to compete with staked itself.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: each notary node can basically choose which chains to notarise

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: by deciding what oracles it will trust to supply its chain parameters

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Imagine if every notary node for KMD did something similar ... used a KMD notary node to run a whole network of notary nodes ðŸ¤”

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Then we really could support milions of blockchains.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Dunno about everyone else, but my mind is blowing thinking about it
